intro: Cabralea polytricha var. goyazana, commonly known as the Goyazan cabralea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
